page.title: 01Tring
page.content: One of Britain's oldest routes,the Icknield way runs from East Anglia to Stonehenge on Salibury Plain,closely following the chalk ridge near Tring. Also the Roman road,Akeman Street cuts through the Chiltern Hills through the Bulbourne Valley.Where these ancient roads cross,you find Tring. Tring is a small market town in the western corner of Hertfordshire. The history of the town can be traced back to Saxon times. The name changed over the centuries from Treunge,Trehanger to Tring.The name is supposed to mean"Trees hanging on the hillside"It was a natural place for a settlement,and it remained a village until the 19th century when the railway and canal opened up the possibility of trade with more distant places.
